text.p: These are the leading stories in the Skopje press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified them and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Macedonian President Kiro Gligorov presented Macedonia's initiative for the development and Europeanisation of the Balkans and southeast Europe at the U.N. General Assembly session. Macedonia announced its candidacy as a non-permanent member of the Security Council.
- Macedonia and the Wrold bank signed a $17 million agreement for the health sector.
- Special U.N. mission for drug control to make a seven-day visit to Macedonia to examine the country's system of prevention of organised crime, corruption and money laundering.
- Macedonians to vote with old identification cards at the November local elections.
